title: Banshees on long range mages will be a problem at some point
body: The counterplay to these long range mages is supposed to be their immobility and being prone to being engaged on. Banshees removes that weakness because these champions typically will be difficult to even pop the shield off in the first place. These champions already can be fairly difficult to engage on due to their long range and giving them the banshees shield will make that a bit more problematic. i like that banshees got a niche pick-up option but I'm not sure this is the correct way to go about it.

Other than the build path being more convenient for AP Champions, why would you think it'd be a bigger problem now than it was before?

I think the idea was to change mid from being "Who can unload their kit first" to "Who can properly weave correct spells in at right times." I don't like the new changes either, mostly because I play assassins so to see every AD build GA and every AP build Banshees really just ruins my game, but for a while now, squishies have been getting demolished often because they get hit my a stray CC out of nowhere and have no answer after that. This will force enemies to decide how they want to break the spell shield, instead of sejuani charging in and throwing her bola for a guaranteed kill, or syndra force pushing a ball into your face and ending your life before you can say fuck. It is the tank meta right now, so they're trying to elongate games so I'd just go with it and build them on ADs and APs since going full squishy, even as a hyper carry mid, won't work as well anymore.

this might be more true if cdr wasn't so abundant. But more than likely they do need to just take the AP down to like 50.
